description.p: A set of thin metal plates the size of playing cards, engraved with an eye on its front side.
You can activate a tile as an action and use it in one the following ways:
View. The tile’s stored image appears as a miniature minor illustion its back side.

Capture. Pointing the tile at something, causes a miniature minor illustion of the tile’s view to appear on its back side. Doing so for one minute causes this image to be stored in the tile until overwritten.
Transfer. You can choose to copy an image from one tile to another by activating them next to each other for one minute.
A small flat stone, covered in magical runes. A stone needs to be paired to another to allow for transport between them.
Send. You can spend 10 minutes in order to send non-living objects that can fit an a 2 foot cube to the stone’s counterpart. The stone can be used this way up to three times until the next dawn.
Receive. When the stone receives objects, certain runes on it start to blink. Using an action you can make them appear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet.
It appears to be a simple potato sack, but using an action, 1d4 potatoes can be removed from it.
Once potatoes have been removed 3 times, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

p.i: The supply of potatoes seemingly is infinite, altough it cannot be said if it produces the potatoes magically or displaces them from somewhere else.
Spellcasting Focus, Uncommon (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

description.p: The Raw Magicum Crystal can be used as a spellcasting focus. While holding this crystal, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls.

Untamed Magic. Every spell of second level or higher that is cast while this crystal is on your body triggers a Wild Magic Surge. Roll a d100 and consult the Wild Magic Surge table for the random magical effect (PHB p. 104).

p.i: Magicum is the basis for refined ATUM fuel.
The wizard Kardos mentioned, that he might be able to remove the chaotic aspect of this crystal, for a fee.
Source: Sunken temple (R17) in the Highland.

description.p: A 10 cm wide puzzle box, engraved with a complex set of runes and movable components, that change every dawn.
This box can only hold one single item no bigger that 5 cubic feet, which appears once the box is opened.

To open the box, without being its owner, requires being occupied with the puzzle over 3 hours of uninterupted concentration. Then roll 3 consecutive DC 16 Intelligence checks. If one of the checks fail, the box "locks" and the puzzle cannot be attempted until it resets at the next dawn.

The last person to successfully open this box is its owner and can get access to it with a touch of their hand. They also receive a mental "alarm" whenever a puzzle attempt fails (provided they are on the same plane of existence).
The box cannot be destroyed by any means short of a Disintegrate or Wish spell.

p.i: Source: Dexter Griff’s corpse, Bunker 109, north-east of Suhast.

description.p: A small bread roll, that is quite old and about as hard as a rock. It is about the size of a fist and when thrown by hand or by sling, it gives you +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While airborne, this bun will scream in fear.
